publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3970 Chris Ballance: Guantanamo Bay—That the Parliament welcomes the call by UN Secretary General Kofi Annan, for the US facility at Guantanamo Bay to be shut as soon as is possible; notes that as many as 500 individuals have been held without trial for up to four years; considers this to be entirely unacceptable, and calls on the US Government to put these men on trial or release them without further delay. Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S2M-3970 Chris Ballance: Guantanamo Bay—That the Parliament welcomes the call by UN Secretary General Kofi Annan, for the US facility at Guantanamo Bay to be shut as soon as is possible; notes that as many as 500 individuals have been held without trial for up to four years; considers this to be entirely unacceptable, and calls on the US Government to put these men on trial or release them without further delay.

S2M-3970 Guantanamo Bay (lodged on 20 February 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Mark Ballard*, Dr Jean Turner*, Fiona Hyslop*, Ms Sandra White*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Patrick Harvie*, Shiona Baird*, Colin Fox*, Campbell Martin*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Robin Harper*, Mr John Swinney*
S2M-3970 Guantanamo Bay (lodged on 20 February 2006) Pauline McNeill*, Eleanor Scott*, Frances Curran*, Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-3970 Guantanamo Bay (lodged on 20 February 2006) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S2M-3970 Guantanamo Bay (lodged on 20 February 2006) John Swinburne*
